messages.content: What is the purpose of LoRA Caption custom nodes in ComfyUI?
LoRA Caption custom nodes allow you to caption images, making them ready for LoRA training.
How do you access LoRA Caption custom nodes in ComfyUI?
You can access LoRA Caption custom nodes by right-clicking and looking for the LJRE category, or by double-clicking an empty space and searching for 'caption'.
Which nodes are mandatory for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI?
WD 1.4 Tagger is mandatory for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI, as it is the one that does the captioning.
What is the function of the Load node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow?
The Load node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow has two jobs: feeding images to the tagger and getting the names of every image file in the folder.
What is the function of the Save node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow?
The Save node in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow creates text files with the image name as its own name and the description of the image as its content.
Are Jjk custom nodes necessary for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI?
No, Jjk custom nodes are optional for the Image-Captioning workflow in ComfyUI.
For which types of images is WD 1.4 Tagger designed?
WD 1.4 Tagger is designed for anime images, although it might also work for realistic images.
What format should the images be in for the LoRA database in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow?
The images for the LoRA database in ComfyUI's Image-Captioning workflow should be in png format.
What should you do if text files already exist and ComfyUI throws an Out of Range error?
If text files already exist, ComfyUI will throw an Out of Range error. To continue, make sure the text files don't exist already, or delete them and relaunch the workflow.
What does the common prefix in the widget of the Load node do?
The common prefix in the widget of the Load node is useful for creating trigger words for your LoRA. If you use the widget, make sure it ends with a comma.
